019package org.jgrapes.net;
020
021import java.io.IOException;
022import java.lang.management.ManagementFactory;
023import java.lang.ref.WeakReference;
024import java.net.InetSocketAddress;
025import java.nio.channels.SelectionKey;
026import java.nio.channels.ServerSocketChannel;
027import java.nio.channels.SocketChannel;
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.Collections;
030import java.util.Comparator;
031import java.util.HashSet;
032import java.util.IntSummaryStatistics;
033import java.util.List;
034import java.util.Optional;
035import java.util.Set;
036import java.util.SortedMap;
037import java.util.TreeMap;
038import java.util.stream.Collectors;
039import javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException;
040import javax.management.MBeanRegistrationException;
041import javax.management.MBeanServer;
042import javax.management.MalformedObjectNameException;
043import javax.management.NotCompliantMBeanException;
044import javax.management.ObjectName;
045import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
046import org.jgrapes.core.Components;
047import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
048import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
049import org.jgrapes.core.Self;
050import org.jgrapes.core.Subchannel;
051import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
052import org.jgrapes.core.events.Error;
053import org.jgrapes.core.events.Start;
054import org.jgrapes.core.events.Stop;
055import org.jgrapes.io.NioHandler;
056import org.jgrapes.io.events.Close;
057import org.jgrapes.io.events.Closed;
058import org.jgrapes.io.events.IOError;
059import org.jgrapes.io.events.Input;
060import org.jgrapes.io.events.NioRegistration;
061import org.jgrapes.io.events.NioRegistration.Registration;
062import org.jgrapes.io.events.Opening;
063import org.jgrapes.io.events.Output;
064import org.jgrapes.io.events.Purge;
065import org.jgrapes.io.util.AvailabilityListener;
066import org.jgrapes.io.util.LinkedIOSubchannel;
067import org.jgrapes.io.util.PermitsPool;
068import org.jgrapes.net.events.Accepted;
069import org.jgrapes.net.events.Ready;
070import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
071
072/**
073 * Provides a TCP server. The server binds to the given address. If the
074 * address is {@code null}, address and port are automatically assigned.
075 * The port may be overwritten by a configuration event
076 * (see {@link #onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate)}).
077 * 
078 * For each established connection, the server creates a new
079 * {@link LinkedIOSubchannel}. The servers basic operation is to
080 * fire {@link Input} (and {@link Closed}) events on the
081 * appropriate subchannel in response to data received from the
082 * network and to handle {@link Output} (and {@link Close}) events 
083 * on the subchannel and forward the information to the network
084 * connection.
085 * 
086 * The server supports limiting the number of concurrent connections
087 * with a {@link PermitsPool}. If such a pool is set as connection
088 * limiter (see {@link #setConnectionLimiter(PermitsPool)}), a
089 * permit is acquired for each new connection attempt. If no more
090 * permits are available, the server sends a {@link Purge} event on
091 * each channel that is purgeable for at least the time span
092 * set with {@link #setMinimalPurgeableTime(long)}. Purgeability 
093 * is derived from the end of record flag of {@link Output} events
094 * (see {@link #onOutput(Output, TcpChannelImpl)}. When using this feature, 
095 * make sure that connections are either short lived or the application
096 * level components support the {@link Purge} event. Else, it may become
097 * impossible to establish new connections.
098 */
099@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.ExcessiveImports", "PMD.ExcessivePublicCount",
100    "PMD.NcssCount", "PMD.EmptyCatchBlock", "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals",
101    "PMD.ExcessiveClassLength" })
102public class TcpServer extends TcpConnectionManager implements NioHandler {
103
104    private InetSocketAddress serverAddress;
105    private ServerSocketChannel serverSocketChannel;
106    private boolean closing;
107    private int backlog;
108    private PermitsPool connLimiter;
109    private Registration registration;
110    private Purger purger;
111    private long minimumPurgeableTime;
112
113    /**
114     * The purger thread.
115     */
116    private class Purger extends Thread implements AvailabilityListener {
117
118        private boolean permitsAvailable = true;
119
120        /**
121         * Instantiates a new purger.
122         */
123        public Purger() {
124            setName(Components.simpleObjectName(this));
125            setDaemon(true);
126        }
127
128        @Override
129        public void availabilityChanged(PermitsPool pool, boolean available) {
130            if (registration == null) {
131                return;
132            }
133            synchronized (this) {
134                permitsAvailable = available;
135                registration.updateInterested(
136                    permitsAvailable ? SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT : 0);
137                if (!permitsAvailable) {
138                    this.notifyAll();
139                }
140            }
141        }
142
143        @Override
144        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
145            "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis", "PMD.CognitiveComplexity" })
146        public void run() {
147            if (connLimiter == null) {
148                return;
149            }
150            try {
151                connLimiter.addListener(this);
152                while (serverSocketChannel.isOpen()) {
153                    synchronized (this) {
154                        while (permitsAvailable) {
155                            wait();
156                        }
157                    }
158                    // Copy to avoid ConcurrentModificationException
159                    List<TcpChannelImpl> candidates;
160                    synchronized (channels) {
161                        candidates = new ArrayList<>(channels);
162                    }
163                    long purgeableSince
164                        = System.currentTimeMillis() - minimumPurgeableTime;
165                    candidates = candidates.stream()
166                        .filter(channel -> channel.isPurgeable()
167                            && channel.purgeableSince() < purgeableSince)
168                        .sorted(new Comparator<TcpChannelImpl>() {
169                            @Override
170                            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortVariable")
171                            public int compare(TcpChannelImpl c1,
172                                    TcpChannelImpl c2) {
173                                if (c1.purgeableSince() < c2
174                                    .purgeableSince()) {
175                                    return 1;
176                                }
177                                if (c1.purgeableSince() > c2
178                                    .purgeableSince()) {
179                                    return -1;
180                                }
181                                return 0;
182                            }
183                        })
184                        .collect(Collectors.toList());
185                    for (TcpChannelImpl channel : candidates) {
186                        // Sorting may have taken time...
187                        if (!channel.isPurgeable()) {
188                            continue;
189                        }
190                        channel.downPipeline().fire(new Purge(), channel);
191                        // Continue only as long as necessary
192                        if (permitsAvailable) {
193                            break;
194                        }
195                    }
196                    sleep(1000);
197                }
198            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
199                // Fall through
200            } finally {
201                connLimiter.removeListener(this);
202            }
203        }
204
205    }
206
207    /**
208     * Creates a new server, using itself as component channel. 
209     */
210    public TcpServer() {
211        this(Channel.SELF);
212    }
213
214    /**
215     * Creates a new server using the given channel.
216     * 
217     * @param componentChannel the component's channel
218     */
219    public TcpServer(Channel componentChannel) {
220        super(componentChannel);
221    }
222
223    /**
224     * Sets the address to bind to. If none is set, the address and port
225     * are assigned automatically.
226     * 
227     * @param serverAddress the address to bind to
228     * @return the TCP server for easy chaining
229     */
230    public TcpServer setServerAddress(InetSocketAddress serverAddress) {
231        this.serverAddress = serverAddress;
232        return this;
233    }
234
235    @Override
236    public TcpServer setBufferSize(int size) {
237        super.setBufferSize(size);
238        return this;
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * The component can be configured with events that include
243     * a path (see @link {@link ConfigurationUpdate#paths()})
244     * that matches this components path (see {@link Manager#componentPath()}).
245     * 
246     * The following properties are recognized:
247     * 
248     * `hostname`
249     * : If given, is used as first parameter for 
250     *   {@link InetSocketAddress#InetSocketAddress(String, int)}.
251     * 
252     * `port`
253     * : If given, is used as parameter for 
254     *   {@link InetSocketAddress#InetSocketAddress(String, int)} 
255     *   or {@link InetSocketAddress#InetSocketAddress(int)}, 
256     *   depending on whether a host name is specified. Defaults to "0".
257     *   
258     * `backlog`
259     * : See {@link #setBacklog(int)}.
260     * 
261     * `bufferSize`
262     * : See {@link #setBufferSize(int)}.
263     * 
264     * @param event the event
265     */
266    @Handler
267    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ConfusingTernary")
268    public void onConfigurationUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate event) {
269        event.values(componentPath()).ifPresent(values -> {
270            String hostname = values.get("hostname");
271            if (hostname != null) {
272                setServerAddress(new InetSocketAddress(hostname,
273                    Integer.parseInt(values.getOrDefault("port", "0"))));
274            } else if (values.containsKey("port")) {
275                setServerAddress(new InetSocketAddress(
276                    Integer.parseInt(values.get("port"))));
277            }
278            Optional.ofNullable(values.get("backlog")).ifPresent(
279                value -> setBacklog(Integer.parseInt(value)));
280            Optional.ofNullable(values.get("bufferSize")).ifPresent(
281                value -> setBufferSize(Integer.parseInt(value)));
282        });
283    }
284
285    /**
286     * Returns the server address. Before starting, the address is the
287     * address set with {@link #setServerAddress(InetSocketAddress)}. After
288     * starting the address is obtained from the created socket.  
289     * 
290     * @return the serverAddress
291     */
292    public InetSocketAddress serverAddress() {
293        try {
294            return serverSocketChannel == null ? serverAddress
295                : (InetSocketAddress) serverSocketChannel.getLocalAddress();
296        } catch (IOException e) {
297            return serverAddress;
298        }
299    }
300
301    /**
302     * Sets the backlog size.
303     * 
304     * @param backlog the backlog to set
305     * @return the TCP server for easy chaining
306     */
307    public TcpServer setBacklog(int backlog) {
308        this.backlog = backlog;
309        return this;
310    }
311
312    /**
313     * Return the configured backlog size.
314     *
315     * @return the backlog
316     */
317    public int backlog() {
318        return backlog;
319    }
320
321    /**
322     * Sets a permit "pool". A new connection is created only if a permit
323     * can be obtained from the pool. 
324     * 
325     * A connection limiter must be set before starting the component.
326     * 
327     * @param connectionLimiter the connection pool to set
328     * @return the TCP server for easy chaining
329     */
330    public TcpServer setConnectionLimiter(PermitsPool connectionLimiter) {
331        this.connLimiter = connectionLimiter;
332        return this;
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * Returns the connection limiter.
337     *
338     * @return the connection Limiter
339     */
340    public PermitsPool getConnectionLimiter() {
341        return connLimiter;
342    }
343
344    /**
345     * Sets a minimal time that a connection must be purgeable (idle)
346     * before it may be purged.
347     *
348     * @param millis the millis
349     * @return the tcp server
350     */
351    public TcpServer setMinimalPurgeableTime(long millis) {
352        this.minimumPurgeableTime = millis;
353        return this;
354    }
355
356    /**
357     * Gets the minimal purgeable time.
358     *
359     * @return the minimal purgeable time
360     */
361    public long getMinimalPurgeableTime() {
362        return minimumPurgeableTime;
363    }
364
365    /**
366     * Starts the server.
367     * 
368     * @param event the start event
369     * @throws IOException if an I/O exception occurred
370     */
371    @Handler
372    public void onStart(Start event) throws IOException {
373        closing = false;
374        serverSocketChannel = ServerSocketChannel.open();
375        serverSocketChannel.bind(serverAddress, backlog);
376        MBeanView.addServer(this);
377        fire(new NioRegistration(this, serverSocketChannel,
378            SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT, this), Channel.BROADCAST);
379    }
380
381    /**
382     * Handles the successful channel registration.
383     *
384     * @param event the event
385     * @throws InterruptedException the interrupted exception
386     * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
387     */
388    @Handler(channels = Self.class)
389    public void onRegistered(NioRegistration.Completed event)
390            throws InterruptedException, IOException {
391        NioHandler handler = event.event().handler();
392        if (handler == this) {
393            if (event.event().get() == null) {
394                fire(new Error(event,
395                    "Registration failed, no NioDispatcher?"));
396                return;
397            }
398            registration = event.event().get();
399            purger = new Purger();
400            purger.start();
401            fire(new Ready(serverSocketChannel.getLocalAddress()));
402            return;
403        }
404        if (handler instanceof TcpChannelImpl) {
405            TcpChannelImpl channel = (TcpChannelImpl) handler;
406            var accepted = new Accepted(channel.nioChannel().getLocalAddress(),
407                channel.nioChannel().getRemoteAddress(), false,
408                Collections.emptyList());
409            var registration = event.event().get();
410            // (1) Opening, (2) Accepted, (3) process input
411            channel.downPipeline().fire(Event.onCompletion(new Opening<Void>(),
412                e -> {
413                    channel.downPipeline().fire(accepted, channel);
414                    channel.registrationComplete(registration);
415                }), channel);
416        }
417    }
418
419    /*
420     * (non-Javadoc)
421     * 
422     * @see org.jgrapes.io.NioSelectable#handleOps(int)
423     */
424    @Override
425    public void handleOps(int ops) {
426        if ((ops & SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT) == 0 || closing) {
427            return;
428        }
429        synchronized (channels) {
430            if (connLimiter != null && !connLimiter.tryAcquire()) {
431                return;
432            }
433            try {
434                @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CloseResource")
435                SocketChannel socketChannel = serverSocketChannel.accept();
436                if (socketChannel == null) {
437                    // "False alarm"
438                    if (connLimiter != null) {
439                        connLimiter.release();
440                    }
441                    return;
442                }
443                channels.add(new TcpChannelImpl(null, socketChannel));
444            } catch (IOException e) {
445                fire(new IOError(null, e));
446            }
447        }
448    }
449
450    @Override
451    protected boolean removeChannel(TcpChannelImpl channel) {
452        synchronized (channels) {
453            if (!channels.remove(channel)) {
454                // Closed already
455                return false;
456            }
457            // In case the server is shutting down
458            channels.notifyAll();
459        }
460        if (connLimiter != null) {
461            connLimiter.release();
462        }
463        return true;
464    }
465
466    /**
467     * Shuts down the server or one of the connections to the server.
468     *
469     * @param event the event
470     * @throws IOException if an I/O exception occurred
471     * @throws InterruptedException if the execution was interrupted
472     */
473    @Handler
474    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
475    public void onClose(Close event) throws IOException, InterruptedException {
476        boolean closeServer = false;
477        for (Channel channel : event.channels()) {
478            if (channels.contains(channel)) {
479                ((TcpChannelImpl) channel).close();
480                continue;
481            }
482            if (channel instanceof Subchannel) {
483                // Some subchannel that we're not interested in.
484                continue;
485            }
486            // Close event on "main" channel
487            closeServer = true;
488        }
489        if (!closeServer) {
490            // Only connection(s) were to be closed.
491            return;
492        }
493        if (!serverSocketChannel.isOpen()) {
494            // Closed already
495            fire(new Closed());
496            return;
497        }
498        synchronized (channels) {
499            closing = true;
500            // Copy to avoid concurrent modification exception
501            Set<TcpChannelImpl> conns = new HashSet<>(channels);
502            for (TcpChannelImpl conn : conns) {
503                conn.close();
504            }
505            while (!channels.isEmpty()) {
506                channels.wait();
507            }
508        }
509        serverSocketChannel.close();
510        purger.interrupt();
511        closing = false;
512        fire(new Closed());
513    }
514
515    /**
516     * Shuts down the server by firing a {@link Close} using the
517     * server as channel. Note that this automatically results
518     * in closing all open connections by the runtime system
519     * and thus in {@link Closed} events on all subchannels.
520     * 
521     * @param event the event
522     */
523    @Handler(priority = -1000)
524    public void onStop(Stop event) {
525        if (closing || !serverSocketChannel.isOpen()) {
526            return;
527        }
528        newSyncEventPipeline().fire(new Close(), this);
529    }
530
531    /**
532     * The Interface of the TcpServer MXBean.
533     */
534    public interface TcpServerMXBean {
535
536        /**
537         * The Class ChannelInfo.
538         */
539        class ChannelInfo {
540
541            private final TcpChannelImpl channel;
542
543            /**
544             * Instantiates a new channel info.
545             *
546             * @param channel the channel
547             */
548            public ChannelInfo(TcpChannelImpl channel) {
549                this.channel = channel;
550            }
551
552            /**
553             * Checks if is purgeable.
554             *
555             * @return true, if is purgeable
556             */
557            public boolean isPurgeable() {
558                return channel.isPurgeable();
559            }
560
561            /**
562             * Gets the downstream pool.
563             *
564             * @return the downstream pool
565             */
566            public String getDownstreamPool() {
567                return channel.readBuffers().name();
568            }
569
570            /**
571             * Gets the upstream pool.
572             *
573             * @return the upstream pool
574             */
575            public String getUpstreamPool() {
576                return channel.byteBufferPool().name();
577            }
578        }
579
580        /**
581         * Gets the component path.
582         *
583         * @return the component path
584         */
585        String getComponentPath();
586
587        /**
588         * Gets the port.
589         *
590         * @return the port
591         */
592        int getPort();
593
594        /**
595         * Gets the channel count.
596         *
597         * @return the channel count
598         */
599        int getChannelCount();
600
601        /**
602         * Gets the channels.
603         *
604         * @return the channels
605         */
606        SortedMap<String, ChannelInfo> getChannels();
607
608    }
609
610    /**
611     * The Class TcpServerInfo.
612     */
613    public static class TcpServerInfo implements TcpServerMXBean {
614
615        private static MBeanServer mbs
616            = ManagementFactory.getPlatformMBeanServer();
617
618        private ObjectName mbeanName;
619        private final WeakReference<TcpServer> serverRef;
620
621        /**
622         * Instantiates a new tcp server info.
623         *
624         * @param server the server
625         */
626        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.EmptyCatchBlock",
627            "PMD.AvoidCatchingGenericException" })
628        public TcpServerInfo(TcpServer server) {
629            serverRef = new WeakReference<>(server);
630            try {
631                int port = server.serverAddress().getPort();
632                mbeanName = new ObjectName("org.jgrapes.io:type="
633                    + TcpServer.class.getSimpleName() + ",name="
634                    + ObjectName.quote(Components.objectName(server)
635                        + " (:" + port + ")"));
636            } catch (MalformedObjectNameException e) {
637                // Should not happen
638            }
639            try {
640                mbs.unregisterMBean(mbeanName);
641            } catch (Exception e) {
642                // Just in case, should not work
643            }
644            try {
645                mbs.registerMBean(this, mbeanName);
646            } catch (InstanceAlreadyExistsException | MBeanRegistrationException
647                    | NotCompliantMBeanException e) {
648                // Have to live with that
649            }
650        }
651
652        /**
653         * Server.
654         *
655         * @return the optional
656         */
657        @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidCatchingGenericException",
658            "PMD.EmptyCatchBlock" })
659        public Optional<TcpServer> server() {
660            TcpServer server = serverRef.get();
661            if (server == null) {
662                try {
663                    mbs.unregisterMBean(mbeanName);
664                } catch (Exception e) {
665                    // Should work.
666                }
667            }
668            return Optional.ofNullable(server);
669        }
670
671        /*
672         * (non-Javadoc)
673         * 
674         * @see org.jgrapes.net.TcpServer.TcpServerMXBean#getComponentPath()
675         */
676        @Override
677        public String getComponentPath() {
678            return server().map(mgr -> mgr.componentPath()).orElse("<removed>");
679        }
680
681        /*
682         * (non-Javadoc)
683         * 
684         * @see org.jgrapes.net.TcpServer.TcpServerMXBean#getPort()
685         */
686        @Override
687        public int getPort() {
688            return server().map(server -> server
689                .serverAddress().getPort()).orElse(0);
690        }
691
692        /*
693         * (non-Javadoc)
694         * 
695         * @see org.jgrapes.net.TcpServer.TcpServerMXBean#getChannelCount()
696         */
697        @Override
698        public int getChannelCount() {
699            return server().map(server -> server.channels.size()).orElse(0);
700        }
701
702        /*
703         * (non-Javadoc)
704         * 
705         * @see org.jgrapes.net.TcpServer.TcpServerMXBean#getChannels()
706         */
707        @Override
708        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
709        public SortedMap<String, ChannelInfo> getChannels() {
710            return server().map(server -> {
711                SortedMap<String, ChannelInfo> result = new TreeMap<>();
712                for (TcpChannelImpl channel : server.channels) {
713                    result.put(channel.nioChannel().socket()
714                        .getRemoteSocketAddress().toString(),
715                        new ChannelInfo(channel));
716                }
717                return result;
718            }).orElse(Collections.emptySortedMap());
719        }
720    }
721
722    /**
723     * An MBean interface for getting information about the TCP servers
724     * and established connections.
725     */
726    public interface TcpServerSummaryMXBean {
727
728        /**
729         * Gets the connections per server statistics.
730         *
731         * @return the connections per server statistics
732         */
733        IntSummaryStatistics getConnectionsPerServerStatistics();
734
735        /**
736         * Gets the servers.
737         *
738         * @return the servers
739         */
740        Set<TcpServerMXBean> getServers();
741    }
742
743    /**
744     * The MBeanView.
745     */
746    private static class MBeanView implements TcpServerSummaryMXBean {
747        private static Set<TcpServerInfo> serverInfos = new HashSet<>();
748
749        /**
750         * Adds the server to the reported servers.
751         *
752         * @param server the server
753         */
754        public static void addServer(TcpServer server) {
755            synchronized (serverInfos) {
756                serverInfos.add(new TcpServerInfo(server));
757            }
758        }
759
760        /**
761         * Returns the infos.
762         *
763         * @return the sets the
764         */
765        private Set<TcpServerInfo> infos() {
766            Set<TcpServerInfo> expired = new HashSet<>();
767            synchronized (serverInfos) {
768                for (TcpServerInfo serverInfo : serverInfos) {
769                    if (!serverInfo.server().isPresent()) {
770                        expired.add(serverInfo);
771                    }
772                }
773                serverInfos.removeAll(expired);
774            }
775            return serverInfos;
776        }
777
778        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
779        @Override
780        public Set<TcpServerMXBean> getServers() {
781            return (Set<TcpServerMXBean>) (Object) infos();
782        }
783
784        @Override
785        public IntSummaryStatistics getConnectionsPerServerStatistics() {
786            return infos().stream().map(info -> info.server().get())
787                .filter(ref -> ref != null).collect(
788                    Collectors.summarizingInt(srv -> srv.channels.size()));
789        }
790    }
791
792    static {
793        try {
794            MBeanServer mbs = ManagementFactory.getPlatformMBeanServer();
795            ObjectName mxbeanName = new ObjectName("org.jgrapes.io:type="
796                + TcpServer.class.getSimpleName() + "s");
797            mbs.registerMBean(new MBeanView(), mxbeanName);
798        } catch (MalformedObjectNameException | InstanceAlreadyExistsException
799                | MBeanRegistrationException | NotCompliantMBeanException e) {
800            // Does not happen
801        }
802    }
803
804}
